text: Make a technical drawing of a steel shaft of your design. The shaft must feature at least one parallel key slot, a gear, and secure placement for two bearings. The shaft must have at least 3 different diameters along its length.\n The drawing must be drawn by hand. It must feature a cross-section view and show examples of surface roughness markings, dimensional tolerances, hole/shaft tolerances, and geometrical tolerances. Use ISO 7200 title block or equivalent.\n The drawing must be scanned (can be done with a phone), titled Drawing_UniversityName.pdf (max 10 MB). Ensure that the quality of the scan is sufficient. The drawing will be judged by accuracy and aesthetics

answer_options.answer_text: Upload is not supported (This answer is correct)

answers.answer_text: Upload is not supported (This answer is correct)

text: The following side sketch represents the side of a car equipped with outboard brakes that provides 65 % of braking on front brakes. In the side view, the swing arm is inclined for 6°.\n Calculate the anti-dive percentage (round up to the first decimal place).

solutions.text: AD = FB ∙ tan Ⴔ ∙l/h = 65% ∙ tan 6° ∙ 1300/250 = 35.5%\n AD = antidive [%], FB – front braking [%], Ⴔ - inclination of the swingarm in side view [°], l- wheelbase, h – height of CoG

text: Calculate the force (F) from the picture if the pump gives a pressure of 5 MPa. Round it to the second decimal:\n dp1 = dp2 = dp3 = 30 mm, dr1 = dr3 = 15 mm, Y = 1,6 X, dr2 = 10 mm, dp4 = 50 mm, dr4 = 20 mm, p4 = 3,5 MPa\n Write the number in N.
Calculate the load in high-speed corners at 200 km/h of a car having a SCz of 3 at Mexico (air density 0,945 kg/m3). What is the loss compared to the sea level?

Based on question 8, what is the new Aerodynamic Balance of a car, after opening the DRS, if the initial balance was 46% (front) and if we assume that the car always acts in the linear segment of its polar SCz/SCx, whose slope has a value of 4,5.\n SCzF constant: assumption (no FRH - Front Ride Height variation)

You want to calculate the laminate of your front bulkhead when designing your monocoque.
 What is the minimum shear strength required?
 Re= 235 MPa; Rm= 350 MPa; τ= 280
 Write the answer in N. Round to the nearest whole number.

A Formula Student car weighs 120 kg, has a wheelbase of 1475 mm, uses 10” tires with magnesium wheels, the front track is 1200 mm, the rear track is 850 mm, and it has a Honda CBR 650r engine. What is true?

answer_options.answer_text: everything is according to the rules
bigger track should be at least 75% of the wheelbase
wheelbase and tracks are not according to the rulebook
weight is under the lower limit

answers.answer_text: everything is according to the rules
bigger track should be at least 75% of the wheelbase
wheelbase and tracks are not according to the rulebook
weight is under the lower limit

text: By the Formula 1 2022 Rulebook, if the race from Novi Marof Karting to Spar Novi Marof (there and back would be one lap, round to one decimal place) would be a Grand Prix, how many laps would the race have to be (consider minimum race length)?\n Karting track Novi Marof: Karting staza Novi Marof\n Spar Novi Marof: SPAR Novi Marof - Google Maps

solutions.text:
Distance from Novi Marof Karting to Spar Novi Marof is 1,3 km. We need to calculate the one lap distance, which would be: 1 lap = 1,3 km ∙ 2 = 2,6 km
 Formula 1 rules dictate, that a full race distance must be a minimum of 305 km: Number of laps = 305 km/2,6 km = 117,3
 Because of those pesky rules, we must have a full number of laps, so the correct answer is 118.
 Because of a different distance acquisition, we also accepted 122 laps
